string.text: Cannot retool loaded magazines.\nRemove all rounds before retooling.

%c[pda_green]Mags Redux
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]Welcome to Mags Redux. This guide will cover most of the features and changes you can expect when using this mod.
 
 %c[pda_green]Loading & Firing Weapons
 %c[pda_white]• %c[ui_gray_2]Weapons that would logically use magazines will require the usage of magazines. Weapons that do not require magazines will behave as in vanilla (shotguns, some bolt-action rifles and revolvers).
 
 %c[pda_white]• %c[ui_gray_2]Ammo must be manually loaded into magazines. The magazine description will indicate what sort of ammo is compatible. To load ammo, drag the ammo item onto the magazine. This will initiate a loading procedure which will load rounds, one by one. To cancel this procedure, click anywhere at any time.
 
 %c[pda_white]• %c[ui_gray_2]To put a magazine into your loadout, '%c[pda_white]right-click%c[ui_gray_2]' the magazine > '%c[pda_white]add to loadout%c[ui_gray_2]'. The magazine background will change color and an icon will be added: this means the magazine has been added to your equipment loadout. If you are holding an eligible weapon, reloading your weapon will utilize the magazine in your loadout.
 
 %c[pda_white]• %c[ui_gray_2]The mod will attempt to automatically select the magazine that has the largest size and has a top round equal to your ammo type. Magazines can also be manually inserted and ejected. '%c[pda_white]Right-click%c[ui_gray_2]' a weapon to find the option to '%c[pda_white]Eject magazine%c[ui_gray_2]'. The Ammo wheel can also be used to swap magazines. Magazines are categorized by the top round.
 
 %c[pda_green]Finding Magazines
 %c[pda_white]• %c[ui_gray_2]Vendors that stock guns will stock magazines. NOTE that '%c[pda_white]Mags Buyable at Traders%c[ui_gray_2]' must be enabled under the 'G.A.M.M.A. Fixes' category in ModOrganizer. %c[pda_white]• %c[ui_gray_2]NPCs, specifically high-rank NPCs have a small chance of dropping improved magazines. These magazines load faster, have higher capacities or both.
 
 %c[pda_green]MCM Options
 %c[pda_white]• Loot Quality: %c[ui_gray_2]Affects quantity of dropped mags, fill amount and chance for improved magazines.
 %c[pda_white]• Load/unload Time Factor: %c[ui_gray_2]Multiplier on the bullet load/unload speed in magazines.
 %c[pda_white]• Fast Loading: %c[ui_gray_2]Enables instant unloading/loading of magazines IN STASH ONLY.
 %c[pda_white]• One In the Chamber: %c[ui_gray_2]Preserves a chambered round when switching mags, just like in real life.
If enabled, empty magazines will stack in inventory instead of being separate.
Sort Inventory As Magazines Are Updated
Uncheck this if you don't like items in your inventory moving around when magazines are updated.
Highlight color for magazines that are part of your loadout.
How much of the UI background is visible through the highlight. Lower values make the highlight more subtle.
If enabled, magazines that work with the same weapon will be grouped together. If disabled, only identical magazines will be grouped together.
If enabled, magazines will be broken into groups based on their top round.
If enabled, you will see magazines currently equipped in your HUD, near your ammo counter.
Enable Ammo Text on Magazine HUD
If enabled, you will see text on the HUD for the first round in a magazine. Requires 'Group by Ammo' to be enabled.
Enable Ammo Icons on Magazine HUD
If enabled, you will see small ammo icons on the HUD for the first round in a magazine. Requires 'Group by Ammo' to be enabled.
If enabled, weapons retain a round in the chamber when magazines are ejected.
If enabled, loading and unloading rounds in stashes will be instant, like in Escape from Tarkov.
If enabled, loading rounds in inventory will be faster, doing so one box at a time.
Magazines below this % will be treated as empty.

Combat Reloading (reloading with inventory closed) works:
 
 • Your loadout is a set of pockets/loops on your vest for magazines. For this example, you have 4 pockets and 4 magazines in your loadout; one magazine for each pocket and a fifth magazine in the gun.
 • Upon reloading, with your gun in one hand, you remove the magazine in the gun with the other hand.
 You now have a gun in one hand and a magazine in the other.
 All four pockets have a magazine in them so the magazine in your hand cannot be put into a pocket and you cannot take a magazine out of a pocket because both of your hands are full. What do you do?
 • In this situation, the magazine is put into your backpack/inventory and you now have a free hand available. to remove a magazine from one of your pockets and insert it into the gun.
 Reload complete!
 • If you start the reload process with a free pocket in your loadout, the magazine from the gun will be put into that pocket, unless the magazine is empty. In this case, it will go into your backpack/inventory. This can be changed so that empty magazines are placed into loadout slots or dropped to the ground within MCM.
Raven still thinks this is wrong...
Modifier to find better magazines and ammo off corpses.
Multiplier on amount of magazines dropped by NPCs.
Multiplier on ammo load amount for magazines dropped by NPCs.
